H0.text: Aquifers are too high up in the mountains, which is why it is not safe to place a fuel depot over them.

H1.text: The weight of the depot is too great over the aquifer, making it unsafe to place a fuel depot on top of an aquifer.

H2.text: The fumes escaping from the fuel depot are explosive, making it unsafe to place a fuel depot over an aquifer.

H3.text: If the fuel leaks, the water in the aquifer will become contaminated is the reason why it is not safe practice to place a fuel depot over an aquifer.

A4.text: Groundwater contamination is a risk, especially for karst aquifers, where rapid flow makes them more sensitive.

A5.text: The rapid groundwater flow rates in karst aquifers make them more sensitive to groundwater contamination than porous aquifers.
